page.title: 02EAST BURTON
page.content: In the top North_East corner of our map is Braytown,this is a residential area of the town of Wool.Most of it consists of modern bungalows though nearby at Giddy Green there are several older properties.These are traditionally built of cob(clay,chalk and straw mixture)and have thatched roofs.Over the main Weymouth to London railway line is East Burton where there are more bungalows,a telephone box and a large farm house with brick and flint walls. At East Burton the water meadows sweep across to the River Frome.These are used as grazing for Fresian cows and horses.Beyond East Burton is a large inn'The Seven Stars'where members of the Caravan Club can park. At Burton Roundabout five roads meet one of them leads to the Atomic Energy Establishment on Winfrith Heath.
